body.directions: Please listen to the audio in Chinese, and then answer the question that follows.

body.textVersion: Audio for 我的头发是...的。 Wǒde tóufà shì ...de.

body.quiz: Which of the following words would complete this sentence?
body.correct: Job well done! The sentence “我的头发是...的。 Wǒde tóufà shì...de “ is used to describe one’s hair; therefore, the word 黑色 hēisè (black) fits to complete the sentence.
body.incorrect: Very close. Please consider what this sentence is used to describe.

body.quiz: Which of the following girls’ hair color can be described with the word in audio?
body.answer: Image of candid portrait of a blonde toddler girl©Shutterstock
options: Image of young woman with black hair©iStock
Image of young girl with red hair©iStock
Image of girl with brown hair ©iStock
body.correct: Excellent job! 金色 jīnsè means “blonde (hair)” or “golden,” and the toddler's hair is blonde.
body.incorrect: So close! Please listen again and pay attention to the first syllable you hear.

body.quiz: Which of the following vegetables is the word in the audio most suitable for?
body.correct: You got it! 红色 hóngsè means “red,” and tomatoes are definitely red.
body.incorrect: Not quite. Do you want to listen to the audio one more time to fully understand the phrase?

body.quiz: Which of the following words is most appropriate to follow the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 害羞 hàixiū
options: Audio for 晚安 wǎn'ān
Audio for 朋友 péngyǒu
Audio for 十二 shièr
body.correct: Outstanding job! The word 很 hěn means “very,” and should be followed by an adjective. So 害羞 hàixiū (shy) is the perfect candidate.
body.incorrect: So close! Please listen to this single syllable again, understand its meaning, and consider what type of word should follow it.

body.quiz: Which of the following words serves the same purpose in a sentence as the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 比较 bǐjiào
options: Audio for 红色 hóngsè
Audio for 女孩 nǚhái
Audio for 晚上 wǎnshàng
body.correct: You got it! 有点 yǒudiǎn (a little) is an adverb of degree, and so is 比较 bǐjiào (somewhat).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Consider what function it serves in a sentence, then select its kindred word.
